title: Larry2bees2
author: Larry2bees2
content: Good morning everyone!I'm sorry for the questionAnd also sorry for the error...I'm new here to learn more about bitcoins...#anyone can help pls

comments.author: Doan9269
comments.body: Let me first use this medium to welcome you to the forum, here there are rules and regulations that guides what we eo and the first thing expected of a newbie is to read and learn the necessary steps expected before going to posting much to avoid having issues with what to post and how the forum works, here are some helpful threads am giving you but first if all begin with the answer to your question about what bitcoin is.bitcoin historyhttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5438353.0Other helpful threads.Unofficial list of (official) Bitcointalk.org rules, guidelines, FAQhttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=703657.0posting etiquetteshttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5184741.0#post_altgiveawayeverything you need to know about forum rank, activities and merits.https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2766177.0Read them and learn, be active on the bitcoin discussion board and your journey to bitcoin just beginsWelcome onboard

comments.author: Zanab247
comments.body: Quote from: Larry2bees2Good morning everyone!I'm sorry for the questionAnd also sorry for the error...I'm new here to learn more about bitcoins...#anyone can help plsYou're new here, and your first Post is to create a topic when you suppose use this time to study the rules that governed the Bitcointalk and Naija local board careful before creating a topic or the person that introduced you into this platform didn't brief you about the local board. hope you know what BTC is all about before coming here to seek for help in this local board? because BTC is different from our fiat money, which you can invest in a particular project and you will get exactly what you want at the moment. I don't know the type of help you want here, I think you are asking where and where to invest your money, if it's were to invest your money, I will advise you not to invest what you can't afford to lose in BTC because it can pump today and dump tomorrow without giving you any notice.
